authors.author: Albert B. Simpson James H. Burke

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Yesterday, today, forever, newline Jesus is the same. newline All may change but Jesus never! newline Glory to His name! newline Glory to His name! newline Glory to His name! newline All may change but Jesus never! newline Glory to His name!

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Oh how sweet the glorious message newline Simple faith may claim: newline Yesterday, today, forever, newline Jesus is the same! newline Still He loves to save the sinful, newline Heal the sick and lame, newline Cheer the mourner, newline Still the tempest. newline Glory to His name!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: He who pardoned erring Peter, newline Never need'st thou fear; newline He that came to faithless Thomas newline All thy doubt will clear. newline He who let the loved disciple, newline On His bosom rest newline Bids thee still, newline With love as tender, newline Leaning upon His breast.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: He who mid the raging billows newline Walked upon the sea newline Still can hush our wildest tempest, newline As on Galilee. newline He who wept and prayed in anguish, newline In Gethsemane, newline Drinks with us each cup of trembling, newline In our agony.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: As of old He walked to Emmaus, newline With them to abide, newline So through all life's way He walketh, newline Ever near our side. newline Soon again shall we behold Him. newline Hasten, Lord, the day! newline But 'twill still be "this same Jesus," newline As He went away.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: He who was the friend of sinners, newline Seeks thee, lost one, now; newline Sinner, come and at His footstool newline Penitently bow. newline He who said, "I'll not condemn thee, newline Go and sin no more;" newline Speaks to thee that word of pardon, newline as in days of yore.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Oft on earth He healed the suff'rer newline By His mighty hand; newline Still our sicknesses and sorrows newline Go at His command. newline He who gave His healing virtue, newline To a woman's touch; newline To the faith that claims His fullness, newline Still will give as much.
